metadata.description: Required. The name of the Azure Factory to create.
Optional. The name of the Managed Virtual Network.
Optional. An array of managed private endpoints objects created in the Data Factory managed virtual network.
Optional. The object for the configuration of a Integration Runtime.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set.
Optional. Boolean to define whether or not to configure git during template deployment.
Optional. Repository type - can be 'FactoryVSTSConfiguration' or 'FactoryGitHubConfiguration'. Default is 'FactoryVSTSConfiguration'.
Optional. The account name.
Optional. The project name. Only relevant for 'FactoryVSTSConfiguration'.
Optional. The repository name.
Optional. The collaboration branch name. Default is 'main'.
Optional. The root folder path name. Default is '/'.
Optional. Specifies the number of days that logs will be kept for; a value of 0 will retain data indefinitely.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.
Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Configuration Details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Optional. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, the latest key version is used.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

properties.repoConfiguration: [if(bool(parameters('gitConfigureLater')), null(), union(createObject('type', parameters('gitRepoType'), 'accountName', parameters('gitAccountName'), 'repositoryName', parameters('gitRepositoryName'), 'collaborationBranch', parameters('gitCollaborationBranch'), 'rootFolder', parameters('gitRootFolder')), if(equals(parameters('gitRepoType'), 'FactoryVSTSConfiguration'), createObject('projectName', parameters('gitProjectName')), createObject()), createObject()))]
properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('cMKKeyName'))), createObject('identity', createObject('userAssignedIdentity', parameters('cMKUserAssignedIdentityResourceId')), 'keyName', parameters('cMKKeyName'), 'keyVersion', if(not(empty(parameters('cMKKeyVersion'))), parameters('cMKKeyVersion'), null()), 'vaultBaseUrl', reference(extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[2], split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults', last(split(parameters('cMKKeyVaultResourceId'), '/'))), '2021-10-01').vaultUri), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent Azure Data Factory. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the Managed Virtual Network.
Optional. An array of managed private endpoints objects created in the Data Factory managed virtual network.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Conditional. The name of the parent data factory. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the parent managed virtual network.
Required. The managed privated endpoint resource name.
Required. The groupId to which the managed private endpoint is created.
Required. Fully qualified domain names.
Required. The ARM resource ID of the resource to which the managed private endpoint is created.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the deployed managed private endpoint.
The resource ID of the deployed managed private endpoint.
The resource group of the deployed managed private endpoint.
The name of the Resource Group the Managed Virtual Network was created in.
The name of the Managed Virtual Network.
The resource ID of the Managed Virtual Network.
Conditional. The name of the parent Azure Data Factory. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the Integration Runtime.
Required. The type of Integration Runtime.
Optional. The name of the Managed Virtual Network if using type "Managed" .
Required. Integration Runtime type properties.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the Resource Group the Integration Runtime was created in.
The name of the Integration Runtime.
The resource ID of the Integration Runtime.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The private DNS zone group configuration used to associate the private endpoint with one or multiple private DNS zones. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The Name of the Azure Data Factory instance.
The Resource ID of the Data factory.
The name of the Resource Group with the Data factory.
The principal ID of the system assigned identity.
The location the resource was deployed into.
